condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not buried?

greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Have I made accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, leading me to prioritize material comfort over spiritual well-being?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through unjust or cruel exercise of power , authority , or influence
oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through unjust or cruel exercise of power, authority, or influence?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: through unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority over them
oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority over them?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: as solely the result of my own hard work and determination
of my own hard work and determination
autonomy.question: Did I view my life's blessings as solely the result of my own hard work and determination, forgetting to acknowledge God's loving hand in all that I have?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: towards others ' good fortune and possessions
envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' good fortune and possessions, and secretly wished for them to lose their blessings?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with words that were unbecoming of my dignity?

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my words to others, using language that was unbecoming and violated their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Have you overindulged in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking in ways that are excessive for my own well - being
in ways that are excessive for my own well - being

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when sharing meals with family members?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing the faults or private affairs of others, even if what I shared was true, with those who might be hurt by it?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, when socializing with friends and family?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger rather than seeking reconciliation when relationships were strained due to disagreements or misunderstandings?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
